speaker: MALCOLM
text_entry: SCENE IV. Outside Macbeth's castle.

speaker: MALCOLM
text_entry: Enter ROSS and an old Man

speaker: Old Man
text_entry: Threescore and ten I can remember well:

speaker: Old Man
text_entry: Within the volume of which time I have seen

speaker: Old Man
text_entry: Hours dreadful and things strange; but this sore night

speaker: Old Man
text_entry: Hath trifled former knowings.

speaker: ROSS
text_entry: Ah, good father,

speaker: ROSS
text_entry: Thou seest, the heavens, as troubled with man's act,

speaker: ROSS
text_entry: Threaten his bloody stage: by the clock, 'tis day,

speaker: ROSS
text_entry: And yet dark night strangles the travelling lamp:

speaker: ROSS
text_entry: Is't night's predominance, or the day's shame,

speaker: ROSS
text_entry: That darkness does the face of earth entomb,

speaker: ROSS
text_entry: When living light should kiss it?

speaker: Old Man
text_entry: 'Tis unnatural,

speaker: Old Man
text_entry: Even like the deed that's done. On Tuesday last,

speaker: Old Man
text_entry: A falcon, towering in her pride of place,

speaker: Old Man
text_entry: Was by a mousing owl hawk'd at and kill'd.

speaker: ROSS
text_entry: And Duncan's horses--a thing most strange and certain--

speaker: ROSS
text_entry: Beauteous and swift, the minions of their race,

speaker: ROSS
text_entry: Turn'd wild in nature, broke their stalls, flung out,

speaker: ROSS
text_entry: Contending 'gainst obedience, as they would make

speaker: ROSS
text_entry: War with mankind.

speaker: Old Man
text_entry: 'Tis said they eat each other.

speaker: ROSS
text_entry: They did so, to the amazement of mine eyes

speaker: ROSS
text_entry: That look'd upon't. Here comes the good Macduff.

speaker: ROSS
text_entry: Enter MACDUFF

speaker: ROSS
text_entry: How goes the world, sir, now?

speaker: MACDUFF
text_entry: Why, see you not?

speaker: ROSS
text_entry: Is't known who did this more than bloody deed?

speaker: MACDUFF
text_entry: Those that Macbeth hath slain.

speaker: ROSS
text_entry: Alas, the day!

speaker: ROSS
text_entry: What good could they pretend?

speaker: MACDUFF
text_entry: They were suborn'd:

speaker: MACDUFF
text_entry: Malcolm and Donalbain, the king's two sons,

speaker: MACDUFF
text_entry: Are stol'n away and fled; which puts upon them

speaker: MACDUFF
text_entry: Suspicion of the deed.

speaker: ROSS
text_entry: 'Gainst nature still!

speaker: ROSS
text_entry: Thriftless ambition, that wilt ravin up

speaker: ROSS
text_entry: Thine own life's means! Then 'tis most like

speaker: ROSS
text_entry: The sovereignty will fall upon Macbeth.

speaker: MACDUFF
text_entry: He is already named, and gone to Scone

speaker: MACDUFF
text_entry: To be invested.

speaker: ROSS
text_entry: Where is Duncan's body?

speaker: MACDUFF
text_entry: Carried to Colmekill,

speaker: MACDUFF
text_entry: The sacred storehouse of his predecessors,

speaker: MACDUFF
text_entry: And guardian of their bones.

speaker: ROSS
text_entry: Will you to Scone?

speaker: MACDUFF
text_entry: No, cousin, I'll to Fife.

speaker: ROSS
text_entry: Well, I will thither.

speaker: MACDUFF
text_entry: Well, may you see things well done there: adieu!

speaker: MACDUFF
text_entry: Lest our old robes sit easier than our new!

speaker: ROSS
text_entry: Farewell, father.

speaker: Old Man
text_entry: God's benison go with you; and with those

speaker: Old Man
text_entry: That would make good of bad, and friends of foes!

speaker: Old Man
text_entry: Exeunt
